alert.note: Alert for Labette; Montgomery (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 6:38PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Labette and eastern Montgomery Counties through 715 PM CST... At 637 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wann, or 10 miles southeast of Caney, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coffeyville, Independence, Cherryvale, Altamont, Dearing, Mound Valley, Liberty, Parsons Tri City Airport, Angola, Big Hill Lake and Coffeyville Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for southeastern Kansas.
